creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
description: standing female figure with proper left arm bent, hand at side; flat mask like face, adorned by earrings and necklace; ridged dress extends to floor covering legs and feet
text: This haniwa represents a female figure. Her necklace of magatama (claw- or fang-shaped jewels of special talismanic power), tells us that she is a shrine attendant, a respected position in early Japanese society. Traces of red pigment on her cheeks indicate tattoos or ceremonial face-paint. Originally she would have worn a wide, flat hairdo that extended over her forehead and would have held a cup with her broken right arm, an indication that she was responsible for formulating medicinal or magical potions.
title: Haniwa of a Female Shrine Attendant
